title: HPD: Dad claims self-defense in fatal shooting of wife, daughter
content:
HOUSTON - Heartbroken relatives of a mother and daughter who were shot to death early Thursday aren't buying the suspect's claim that it was self-defense.
Sandtrece Latoya Raliff, 44, and her 14-year-old daughter Ariel Ratliff were gunned down in their home on Alkay at Anderson in southwest Houston.
Ratliff's husband called 911 and admitted he shot them both, according to police. He claims he did it in self-defense because they were trying to attack him with knives.
"There's just no way that he could feel so threatened to carry out such an action to his wife and his daughter," said Desmond Bertrand, a relative. "And then the range and where she was shot, there's just no way."
Ariel died at the scene. Her mother was rushed to the hospital with a gunshot wound to the head where she later died.
The father, 43, was taken into custody for questioning.
Charges have not been filed in the case, but the investigation is ongoing. Police confirm they'd been called to the house before -- most recently on an assault allegation in April -- but no charges were filed in those cases.
"They were together, but separate, their family was coming back together, working on issues," Bertrand said.
Neighbors were shocked.
"It's breaking my heart, it's really sad, it almost sounds unreal," said Gilbert Garcia.
"They seemed to be really nice people, all of them, every time i would see them, they would wave at me," said Perry Green.
HPD asked for anyone with information to call homicide investigators at 713-308-3600 or Houston Crime Stoppers at 713-222-TIPS.
